author: {'steamid': '76561198809794025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2272, 'last_played': 1592065382}
review:
Игра прошла долгий путь через ранний доступ и теперь...
А теперь ничего- игра сырая и не доделанная.
Миссии: много разнообразных и разно преподнесённых, но всего два типа- убей врагов или убей врагов и принеси предмет (если вы не сделаете первый пункт-вас мгновенно уничтожат). И к каждой мисси на любой планете прилагается мини игра на 10-30 минут в зависимости от прочности грунта: собери все ресурсы ( если вы этого не сделаете- "недостатий" на ремонт корабля кончиться и игра проиграна).
 Отдельно хочется упомянуть врагов- каждый тип возрождается из соответствующего строения причём группами от 3 до 6 с интервалом в 5-15 секунд на группу. Поэтому воевать с врагами бессмысленно-единственная работающая тактика-настреливать издалека по зданиям. Да, ещё много взрывающихся врагов которые наносят бесконечно много урона в радиусе поражения ( ни одна деталька вашего дрона не выстоит), что оставляет выбор оружия весьма скудным.

Режим кампании весьма унылый-механики бывшие в альфе разделили по командирам, в итоге получилось грустно.
+ постоянно возрастающая стоимость ремонта вынуждает тратить всё больше времени на сбор ресурсов.

Баги-есть и очень раздражающие. (1.Магнит, притягивая крупный предмет, заставляет ваш дрон крутиться как сумасшедший с ускорением-прощай закон сохранения момента импульса. 2. Если вам не повезло и одна деталька вашего дрона нагрелась до "повреждающей температуры" то тепло распространиться на соседние ,увеличиваясь в геометрической прогрессии, и ваш дрон сгорит в волнах огня. 3. Некоторые детали просто не работают.4...)  
Итог: лучше потратить своё время на что-нибудь другое, либо дождаться пока игру доведут до ума...

author: {'steamid': '76561198378116386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 19652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4148, 'last_played': 1708520835}
review:
Der Schwerpunkt von Nimbatus ist wohl das entwerfen und verbessern von Dronen.

Mit diesen selbst gestalteten Dronen gilt es ein überschaubare Anzahl an unterschiedlichen Zielen auf zufällig erstellten Planeten zu erreichen.

Es gibt zwei Ressourcen welche man auf Planeten finend und abbauen kann, diese werden zum einsetzen von großen Dronen gebraucht oder zum kaufen von Upgrades/Teilen.

Zu Anfang des Spieles entscheidet man sich mit welchem Kapitän man an Board gehen möchte, während das "Schwergewicht" einem mehr Leben gibt ist der "Pilot" schneller, Die Unterschiedlichen Kapitäne sorgen auf jeden Fall dafür das sich mehr als ein spiel Durchlauf lohnt. 

Als "Ingenieur" Stehen einem Logik teile zur Verfügung.
So kann man z.b. eine große Drone bauen die sich in mehre kleine zerteilt wovon die dann ein Teil zum Missions Ziel unterwegs ist und ein anderer Teil Ressourcen sammeln geht.

Für die erfahrenen Spieler gibt es noch den "Programmierer" als Kapitän, mit diesem hat man unbegrenzt an Baumaterial und kann Problemlos große Dronen bauen, jedoch müssen diese nach beginn der Mission komplett selbständig arbeiten. Bedeutet erstellen von vielen logischen Verknüpfungen und viel testen.

Wenn man gerne bastelt und testet sollte man glücklich mit Nibatus werden.
Sollte man jedoch ein Spiel suchen wo man einfach los Fliegen und rum Ballern kann ohne selber zu basteln, so ist Nimbatus wahrscheinlich nicht das Richtige Spiel für einen, auch wenn der Steam-Workshop vorlagen bietet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198237577814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 910, 'last_played': 1634589672}
review:
NOTE: I have previous professional programming experience for 20 years in the I.T. field, and also enjoy open-ended sandbox games like SimpleRockets (1 and 2), Cosmoteer, Celestial Command, Universe Sandbox, and Factorio.

TL;DR I recommend getting this game because you have a lot of parts to design anything you want, the low-end graphics allow you to run this game on any desktop or laptop, and the sandbox mode, though a little rough around the edges, and the test flight area, allow you two play areas to create your own custom scenarios to test your drone creations in. The devs and community are extremely helpful. The game is great. It is just out of the gate (May 2020) so expect it to grow and improve over time. It's worth sticking with it.

Detailed review follows:

Nimbatus Space Drone Constructor is set in the future, where Man has finally broken free of the solar system, to explore the Universe through a warp powered starship called Nimbatus. The primary function of the starship is to design drones of any type of configuration suited to completing a mission task, which is always set on a planet. The planets themselves have specific biomes (jungle, fire, ice, ore-laden, etc), and have varying attributes of wind and gravity.

Designing a drone is fairly simple. You start off with a core. which could be considered the brain, and attach parts on top of it to make something that will complete the task on that planet. There is a test flight mode that is basically a spartan barebones arena to try out what you constructed. When you are satisfied with your creation, you launch the drone and pilot it into the atmosphere of the planet either manually or by using a combination of logic and sensor parts to create something that runs by itself, which is easily doable. From there, you hope the drone does what you designed it to do. Sometimes it works, sometimes it does not. When it doesn't, you have to try again and depending on what mode of the game you are playing (single player), there's a cost and a risk assigned to it. I'll touch on the risk part in more detail later.

There are two modes: 

* single player that splits in either a story driven campaign, or an open sandbox
* multiplayer. 

Since I suck at PvP, I only single player and will describe my experience in both.

The single player's story driven campaign mode is where you command NIMBATUS on its maiden flight to explore the Universe but...oh crap...another starship comes out of the blue....err...black since it's space...damages your ship and makes off with your warp drive. Now you're a dented wreck and trapped in orbit around a planet. The backstory of this starship, from something called CORP (an evil corporation), isn't exactly much. It did remind me of a Knight Rider storyline where K.A.R.R., the evil twin of K.I.T.T.,  was sent out to destroy K.I.T.T. and his hood ornament .....excuse me, driver, Michael Knight.

Anyways, moving on: NIMBATUS is in pretty bad shape. It's damaged, trapped in orbit around a planet, with an evil doppleganger out to kill it. You advance this storyline by exploring planet by planet with your drones, and each planet has a mission. You complete a mission, you get a reward that can be used to repair and upgrade NIMBATUS and unlock new technologies to use. 

There is however a cost to doing this. Every time you launch a drone, it costs currency to launch a drone, and it also increases the chances the CORP starship will again find you and fire upon you again. This chance of detection, the risk I alluded to earlier is called a Threat level. These two factors I found somewhat limiting because pretty soon I discovered that I spent too much time on a planet mining for resources or struggling with biome dynamics. That increased the cost and the threat to the point of not being able to get too far into the single player storyline.  I only managed to get a few episodes past the selection of a human pilot class (something that works to classes in World of Warcraft with specific traits for each) to take over NIMBATUS. I ended up either being out of launch resources or NIMBATUS being too damaged to continue or destroyed.

The second single player mode, the sandbox, is something I enjoyed more than the single player mode, though there were some ehhhhhs I had with it.  The sandbox mode allows you to freely explore all the planets in the game universe without being locked into a story path. The universe itself is generated and the planets created using a random number seed. In this game there are some control settings that make your exploration easier. There is no drone launch cost, and you can turn off the threat buildup so the CORP ship never finds you. If the mission for the planet is something you think you can do, you can change the mission to something simplier. You can even set the enemy damage level and the difficulty level to the point to make your exploration less hazardous. 

Having said this, it's not a pure sandbox. I'm used to "instant action" modes from Warcraft III and Activision's Star Trek games where you can customize even the most minute things. I'm used to being able to set the mission goals to something as precise as "kill x items belonging to y within the time limit of z:zz". I'm used to placing friendlies and enemies at specific locations of a map I designed myself. Call me spoiled but that's a sandbox. The sandbox in Nimbatus Space Drone Constructor works but only up to a point: there are some rough edges with it. Even if there are some things I can change, the sandbox is still unchangable in some parts, and mixing mission types with biomes can sometimes result in an unpredictable mix that works against you.

Sometimes I just want a customized area that has zero life where I can just play with a creation, like in Simple Rockets or Factorio.

Now, you might be thinking, "He recommends buying this game but casts a bit of shade on some parts of it. How does that fit together?"

The game was launched in May 2020 and is in constant improvement and enhancements as we speak. It's a good game now, and I have every confidence that the rough spots I mentioned will get smoothed out and it will become an absolute kick@ss sandbox-like game down the road. 

Stray Fawn have a Discord server and their own web page forums that invite suggestions on what players want to see added in the game down the road. I've added a number of suggestions to strengthen the sandbox part of it. The community is extremely friendly and active. They will answer any questions you have.

There's even a wiki for it though it needs more content added to it. 

You can literally build anything you want from over 70 parts, with your creation having a lot of ways to be controlled. A good chunk of the parts --- logic and sensors --- allow you to build something that can run by itself without manual intervention. The most advanced drone I have built is something that splits into two parts, each controlled by a set of keys to operate independently once separated. One part can fire weapons, the other part can mine. If you are like me and like just building things to see if they work, you'll find yourself f@rting around in the Testflight part of the Drone editor. While that area is little better than a gridmarked barebones arena, it's enough if all you want to do is fiddle and tinker. 

The game uses a simple 2D plane environment as its graphic world, so virtually any laptop or computer will have no trouble running it, unless what you have is nearly 10 years old.  It's smart and efficient in both presentation and user-interface and is quite intuitive. It's not hard to learn what to do because of this.

My verdict is to buy it, get registered on Stray Fawn's home page with your Steam account, and engage with the community if you need help. This game is great, is getting better, and has a bright future ahead of it.

review:
Juste excellent ! On peut construire n'importe quoi. Vous pouvez faire des lance missiles, des tourelles automatiques, des drones articulés, des lanceurs de mini drones, etc. Vraiment le jeu est libre.
Par contre, la survie est peu ouf. On est très limités au début alors que les ennemis sont vachement puissants. De plus, je me serais bien passé de la gestion du vaisseau mère.
Le mode créatif est marrant pour construire ce qu'on veut mais après avoir réalisé tout ce qu'on avait en tête... bah le jeu est plus ou moins fini. Un mode team deathmatch en multijoueur pourrait ajouter une bonne durée de vie.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051654867', 'num_games_owned': 1354, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 1281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1157, 'last_played': 1591197401}
review:
My take on Nimbatus : The Space Drone Constructor

It's a 2D Drone Building / Operating / Programming. You construct Drones and make them do things. You Start with the Drone Core (comes with self-destruct function) You add parts to them. Thrusters, Armors, Weapons, Fuel/Energy Supplies, Resource Tank (for collecting resources), Mechanical parts (Hinges, Motors, Piston, etc.,), Sensors (to sense stuffs around the drone), Logic parts (for advance control or even Autonomus drone), then Test flight adjust to your heart content. then complete your Objective. That's pretty much it.

There are several game modes to play with. 
1. [u]Singleplayer[/u] mode has Missions and stories about your Nimbatus spaceship. You hop from planet to planet, to each star system to reach your destination, solving problem and gathering resources along the way. Kind of Like FTL star map with totally different gameplay. Singleplayer mode probably include other game modes in the mission form. so you can just play singleplayer and experience most game modes the game has.

2. [u]Multiplayer Mode[/u]: consist of Timed Racing, Sumo, Brawl, Race, Catch.
Timed Racing : You build your Fastest drone to compete in Race tracks to get you Best time on the Leaderboard.
Sumo : You Build your Sumo Drone to push the competitor drone out of the ring in a Tournament and become the Sumo Drone Champion.
Brawl : You build your Fighter Drone to Enter the Drone Deathmatchs Tournament. Win and become the Greatest Drone Warrior Constructor.
Race : You build your Fastest Drone to Race against the other Drone.
Catch : You build your Drone to... Catch the Ball? before the other drone catch it and score? Probably somewhat like Harry Potter catching snitch ball??? i havn't really try this mode yet sorry.

You can also play [u]Versus[/u] with your friend on each mode (in the Training section) just for fun.

So those are the Modes that the game offers. The biggest part of the game is obviously the Drone Construction. You can build them however you want assign Keys to control each parts or all of the parts or assign key to the part to trigger the other part to trigger even more parts. Or you can try building the Advance control with Logic gates to make even more Complicate drones. Or, if it's your thing, you could just build the Fully Autonomous Drones (to me, it feels like i can design my own Autonomous Vacuum Bots)

[b]I only have one complain on this game[/b]. The Logic parts are kinda massive compare to the ship size. Each Logic gate require 2 Block Space and has 0.25 mass. So when you build a really complex autonomous Drones. it become an Unnecessary Massive drone which require so many Thrusters and Fuel Tanks which make it even more Massive. Also once you make a really complex Logic System [b][u]It became super-difficult to track[/u][/b] which Button has been assign to which. you can only check by click on each logic part one-at-a-time.
say, imagine having like 100 parts of logic gates.

Still Recommend the game for anyone who like this kind of thing.

[i]"If you like Spending 2 hours making a drone for a 2 minutes Mission."[/i]
[b][i]-Recommended!!-[/i][/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198090120509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7026, 'last_played': 1640128310}
review:
I have always loved building all the way back to my first Lego set. I like building forts in my real space around me. I later got into Minecraft and that was a natural next step for me. Then I discovered Robocraft. I was able to take all of my experience from forts, Legos, and Minecraft and turn it into two thousand hours of creative building.

Then Nimbatus was released. It has the best physics I have ever seen in a building game. In most games I have played a block is a block is a block. Nimbatus is not this, a block is only a block if you let yourself be put into a box. For instance, a block has 2000 hp it can only take 2001 damage before breaking, right? Nope, if you start to play around with tension and resistance you realize that 2000 hp is very dynamic. 

This is a single player game by design, but without changing a single thing in the game you can turn it into a co-op game by making modular ships that can detach from each other. Now, all you have to do is map the controls to different keys on the keyboard and BAM! A single player game is a four player game. Say that is not your preference, you could go play it like Star Trek bridge command. Someone takes navigation, someone takes weapons, someone takes defense and someone takes sub-systems. What if none of that sounds like what you want? Maybe the online PVP is more your style, which is basically Robot Wars. This is an arena where you have to enter drones you make and automate them to fight other drones. 

So to make a very long story short, Nimbatus is incredibly dynamic and what you get from it is going to be completely different from what the person just to your left or right may get out of it. 

Thank you for taking the time to read this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974343533', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2279, 'last_played': 1590964115}
review:
This is tough to rate this as not recommended.

The main appeal of this game, for me, was concept of creating completely autonomous spacecraft. And at a glance, it does that very well. I was able to create several different ships that were able to go off alone and solve missions by themselves, and even a 'factory mothership' that would replicate a variety of subordinate drones that would do the dirty work for mom. It is pretty satisfying at first, almost like a simulation of 2D electronics with a unique environment to play with. 

The problem comes during the scaling up these automatons, which the creators seem confident that this game is made for, seems how there is an achievement for having 100 or more logic gates (my most complicated working creation contained only 55). Which, gets me to my first and main complaint of why this game isn't very friendly for people like me that just want to create autonomous machines. 

Besides sensors, almost the entirety of an automated ship is done with simple logic gates. That means at most two inputs, and ALWAYS only 1 output. Whats more is that each logic gate requires its own physical component that you must accommodate for. This becomes very annoying, because it forces you to try to group these components in physical space, because YOU CANNOT SEE THE INPUT OR OUTPUT WITHOUT CLICKING ON EACH INDIVIDUAL LOGIC GATE, SENSOR, OR MECHANISM. Inputs and outputs are defined as bindings to specific keys (or keywords), and you can't even get a list of these bindings that are already in use. There are absolutely no user friendly tools to help organize the logical structure of your machines. At the very least, there should be larger components that can group more than one logic gate, much like an integrated chip.

I swear, I have created more complicated electronics in real life that were simpler to create. This feeling of frustration was amplified by my second complaint. Much like in real life electronics, things just break for no apparent reason. At first I have a self destruct mechanism working perfectly (in case a factory drone loses too many sensors), and then I want to add a few extra components that do not use any of the same inputs or outputs, and BOOM, my self destruct mechanism goes off automatically right when the factory prints the drone. A similar issue happens with the import/export system. I have a perfectly working ship, I want to try to modify it in sandbox mode, and for whatever reason, the ship decides to behave completely differently, even though it is an exact clone. 

I wanted to at least complete the game before I looked at any user tutorials or check out anyone else's creations, so I can't tell if others playing this game are as focused on creating ships with no user input. I know others have been more successful than I, because clearly some people have beat the game on Programmer. I started working on a ship to solve the last mission, but decided the frustration wasn't worth it when I tried to recreate and combine three factory drones that worked perfectly by themselves, but malfunctioned even though they don't share I/O. I am sure I could debug it, but that means I have to go through over individual 70 logic gates and their associated sensors and mechanisms. I drew my own diagrams to do this with other ships, but It just isn't worth it at larger scales without some sort of tools.

Like I said, this game is very intriguing to me. I am glad I bought it, but at the same time I don't know if I can recommend it, because the frustration has left me wanting to wait and see if the issues I have are addressed. I will absolutely be back if some user friendly features are added, and I hope to have a positive review then.

review:
The game is fun, but infuriating game mechanics prevent me from enjoying it:

- Random travel damage. You lose hull for traveling with no great way to repair it. You can go to shops but not every system has one.  In most cases, you end up pretty quickly SOL with no way for recovery

- Missions are fun, ship building is fun but resource expenses aren't.  The cost is often so high that you spend it too soon, or cost to redeploy is too great.

Overall, punishes new players with a learning curve steeper than there needs to be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103443352', 'num_games_owned': 3577, 'num_reviews': 299, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1590648375}
review:
[quote]
关注[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/39039781]斗鱼游戏社区[/url]，随时了解主播推荐的好游戏。
访问[b]斗鱼鱼吧社区[/b]参与互动，活动好礼送不停！
[/quote]

[h1]我以为是个设计游戏，结果居然是个赛车游戏[/h1]

[h1]关于游戏[/h1]
Nimbatus - The Space Drone Constructor，一款打着设计无人机的幌子实际上是个赛车游戏的游戏——我是说手动模式。而自动模式下，你会被高中、大学逻辑课程的痛苦所支配。当你刚上手的时候，你会无比痛苦，而当你变得熟练，你会无比爱它。
 
[h1]游戏画面[/h1]
在基本UI和大部分时间，游戏的画面有着金属的冷峻和科级的沉稳，而太空中的星球则像是夸张的烂奶酪，两种风格形成了鲜明的对比，但是又构成了奇妙的和谐和平衡。
 
[h1]游戏模式[/h1]
目前游戏分为多人模式和单人模式。
在多人模式下，你可以连接到steam上，同其他玩家进行五种竞技，其中竞速分手/自两种模式，而其他四种都只有自动模式——考验着你的设计能力。当然你可以从创意工坊下载别人的设计方案，进行学习。
 
单人模式主要是教程和战役。强烈建议在开始游戏前通一遍教程。

战役采取了类似FTL一样的非线性叙事模式，你可以选择自己的探索路径，而每探索一个地区，敌人就会更加警觉，直到进入下一个区域。
 
故事讲述的在未来，人类开始太空殖民，而你的飞船遭到了敌人的袭击，你不得不用最基本的无人机逐步收集资源，探索太空。
 
而故事也从一开始的建造最简单的无人机，收集黑匣子，到开始装配武器、收集资源等，教玩家逐步设计功能不断增加的无人机。同时，游戏还有着技能树，可以消耗资源提升无人机的各种效能。
 
而此时，手动模式的难点就来了，因为你不仅要设计无人机，你还得亲自操控无人机。提到无人机的操控手感，我泪流满面——即使你采用了对称设计、注意保持了重心，开起来依然像是一个没开过车的人开着一辆打开了竞速模式的跑车，跑起来总是偏的，而且还有很强的惯性，真的特别难操控，特别是我这种一直不会刹车的赛车游戏菜鸡玩家。

而假如你选择了自动模式，恭喜你，首先你要搞清楚逻辑信号，而且安装到无人机上，让它能做出判断，否则你的无人机发射之后就会静静地沉没……也就是说，你可能要向回到学校一样好好学习或者复习一下逻辑等课程。
 
[h1]游戏感受[/h1]
Nimbatus - The Space Drone Constructor，一款让我又爱又恨的游戏，我爱它，因为它有无限可能，我恨它，因为它有无限可能。

author: {'steamid': '76561198076308670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1590176934}
review:
+ Looks fun to start with. some FTL-inspired galaxy progression.
+ First 1-2 hours are great as you discover what makes the game tick.

- If you prefer to min/max, this game will be a nightmare for you.  You can't bind thrusters to multiple keys, forcing you to hold LEFT/RIGHT buttons together to go forward. Same applies for reverse, you in effect need to have 2 sets of thrusters, one set for turning, another for forward/reverse movement.

- Oh did I mention you will hate it if you like to min/max? Well you actually can bind the keys via the game-provided logic gates.... which take 2x1 slot of your craft and can be destroyed... Besides you'll have to find the said logical gates as a reward.. and in a limited quantity. Just to be able to manufacture some QOL for yourself...

- You can't zoom out far enough to see at the max range of your own weapons.

- Game advises you "not to connect many things to one root node" otherwise it will cause wobble. Which in effect is equivalent to devs saying that they can't use a 2D physics library to make it so that the craft don't self destruct spontaneously. Think those funny moments when ragdoll gets stuck in a door... just with your craft.

- Temperature effects are weird. You can fly through lava, but then without any indication your entire craft starts taking a "tick" of heat increase every second for ~20-30 seconds. I get that they may be trying to simulate "lava" being stuck to the surfaces... but there is no visual indication whatsoever.

- Did I mention temperature? You like automatic stuff? Well enjoy  having to place 2x1 temperature sensor, besides all of the logic required to make it work.

- You can't see yourself if you fly into the "resource container". Making it a pain to try to get out. Esp. with larger drones.

-- The batteries / fuel tanks drain unevenly, and only recharge when they start draining. Resulting in you always being stuck at however many fully drained cells/tanks you need to sustain the weapons/engines you are firing. Meaning when you should actually be at 100% energy (meaning can out-regen weapon drain) you actually can be at only 10% energy total. If you then decide to fire 2nd weapon group... you'll only have that 10% to tap into.

- Resource containers fill individually, rather than evenly. Why??...


--- Overall the amount of content in the game is quite minimal. Most enemy units either shoot or ram you, with minimal to no difference in their behaviour. The approach of dealing with them is almost always to spam everything you have in their direction while either flying away when they aggro or just tanking it with shields. 

-- The missions are very shallow and almost always feel samey. Either a fetch or a destroy quest. 

-- The weapons available are different, but honestly they do not feel significantly different. You very quickly reach a point where you can spam enough batteries / weapons to not care what it is specifically that you are firing towards the enemy. I'd say the only notable part is with larger bugs trying to run if you set them on fire. And annoying when some enemies continue to function without issue if frozen. So almost always its more reliable to go with pure damage alone (kinetic).



Overall I went into this game looking forward to eventually having fun building complex automated systems in an FTL-esque universe. What I feel I got is a sub-par experience with a game that the devs pinched a few ideas from different games and cobbled it together with intern-level graphics to boot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025853424', 'num_games_owned': 1136, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1589648458}
review:
Review in video form:

https://youtu.be/MB-JxYQtNA8

Review in written form:

Nimbatus is a 2D shooty constructor roguelike and that's probably the weirdest way to describe a game, but it is the most accurate way in this case, I think. 

Positives:

- great selection of parts and customization, allowing you to make fairly diverse drones. The ability to build and pilot a complex drone is THE draw to this game in my opinion.

- variety of playstyles to choose from, including one where you get infinite parts, but your drones will be automatic, so you'll need to preplan all their movements in advance.

- good music and visuals.

Negatives:

- limited in scope and gameplay. The whole point in the game is to keep on moving. You will need to finish X amount of misions per universe in order to move on to the next universe. The missions seem to always be "uncover the map", "destroy X", "Find/ dig up Y". This sounds like a good selection, but in reality, you'll at maximum have 6-8 missions to choose from and a bunch of them can be identical.

- it's a small indie game. Don't expect miracles.

Overall this game is not for me. I found it too difficult and I'm not too much into the whole space aspect. That being said, what I found there, the drone construction part, it felt impressive. I believe that there's definitely fun to be had for those that like these kinds of games, so I don't view it negatively.

review:
Jeu acheté les yeux fermés, et à l'heure actuelle, je n'ai aucun regret.
Il à son petit univers bien à lui, le design est cool, et les musiques adaptées aux environnement le sont tout autant.

Il n'y a à proprement parler pas de limite, si ce n'est la taille de la carte ou votre PC (vous avez la possibilité d'avaler des planètes entières si vous le désirez)
Les modes de jeux sont très variés, au commencement vous pourrez choisir entre plusieurs "capitaines" dont les bonus changeront votre gameplay. Il en va de jouer "à la cool" en mode semi-arcade, ou carrément programmer des drones autonomes de A à Z pour une expérience plus complexe (et c'est prenant, on ne voit pas les heures passer à la construction)
Si le mode aventure ne vous convient pas, il y a toujours le mode bac à sable paramétrable qui vous permettra de jouer un mode libre, ou en semi-libre à mi-chemin du mode aventure en choisissant vos propres règles.
Les armes sont variées, disposent de différents types (cinétique, biologique, cryogénique, thermique) et sont toutes personnalisables via un arbre technologique bien fourni, ce qui vous permettra par exemple de déterminer combien de projectiles seront envoyés, leur vitesse, le recul... etc.

En bref, allez-y, c'est du beau boulot.

review:
Survival mode is repetitive, grinded for 20 hours in order to create resources for a bigger drone, then i reach galaxy 4 and fight the final planet with my small drone and win so easily. Multiplayer is fun though, found myself playin 10 hours of it, trying to make drones to one of those modes. The game can be hard as if you lose once on a planet, you can't restart and instead have to waste resources + increase the chance of having your hull hit. I advise getting all storage and fabrication upgrades like i did on my second run, then you simply dont have to worry bout drone costs...the red crystals are still hard to find though, and for my researcher campaing i ended it without upgrading much of my weapons, if any, at all.

EDIT: I can't recommend this game anymore, as i was just bout to grab all unlockables and reach galaxy 9, my Kaspersky anti virus, who i had no idea was still under subscription, closed my game and deleted my 50 hour campaing, literally deleted the save file for no reason (''it said the game was acting suspiciously''). I have no clue what happened. Really upset with Kaspersky Anti Virus. Prob not doing 50 hours again for a random save file delete.
Edit 2: Extended Kaspersky Anti Virus license but i had soo many issues buying it again. First, the auto renewal doesnt work, it said i was supposed to pay R$ 139 with discount, but in fact i paid R$ 179 (both values of the brazilian currency) with a new account, as it was not allowing me to renew for the 1st price. author: {'steamid': '76561198840205552', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2547, 'last_played': 1598615390}
review:
游戏很好，如果你喜欢Besiege，那你应该也会喜欢这款游戏。

相对于Besiege，这款游戏不再需要复杂的Besiege物理学和Besiege机械学，你只需要懂一点受力分析就可以建造出很易于操控的飞船。

如果你还懂得如何使用门，那你会体会到这游戏的所有魅力，建造你的全自动飞船，解决各种难题，在竞技场上与别人的飞船一较高先，或者用密集的火力屠戮外星生物。这款游戏可以给你发挥想象力的平台。

美中不足的一点是，生存模式的任务类型和随机事件比较少，在玩过几个关卡后就没什么新意了，所以我在玩过一次手操角色生存模式以后就没有玩这个模式的欲望了。可以看出，生存模式的机制是借鉴ftl，ftl吸引人的地方之一是大量的随机事件，而本作的随机事件只有打捞沉船，遭遇商店和敌军，能否加入一些像送货、发现隐藏地点的随机事件。另外本作里重复冗长的任务实在有些枯燥。希望开发者在后续的更新里加入更多任务和随机事件。

个人感觉游戏流程短，我刚凑齐10挺狙击枪，2个三级跟踪导弹，升级满雷达就结束了，最终任务也没有最终任务的牌面，感觉不够尽兴。

另外关于这款游戏我有一个建议，能否让一个部件可以设置多个键位？比如一个引擎我按下a或b它都可以启动，这样可以省下很多门，也使游戏生存模式早期的飞船更易于操控。

author: {'steamid': '76561198011324641', 'num_games_owned': 1270, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1590294414}
review: I've played the game maybe 10 minutes and the rest was just slapping pieces together just for the ship to shake violently and self-destruct in the testing area. What kind of ship builder doesn't let you build a ship.
developer_response:
Hi Saugan

I'm very sorry that it got frustrating for you early on. With which gameplay mode did you start?

We know that there's a learning curve in building, but we hope to make it acceptable when you start with the tutorials. Did you get the chance to play them?

Some tips for making stable drones:
- Start with small drones which are stable. Try them in test drive and make them bigger if those work.
- If you add parts, add them close or directly next to the part it is linked to. Longer connections are less stable and can lead to wobble (imagine carrying a heavy metal ball. You carry it close to your body, not with extended arms).
- If you make bigger drones, links parts together. Link lighter parts to heavier ones, and the heavier ones are closer to the core.

I hope those few tips help you get started. We're trying to improve the on-boarding but need feedback to see what works and what doesn't :) Your feedback is very important to us.

Please let me know if those tips helped you make more stable drones.

Cheers and thank you for your help,
Markus

author: {'steamid': '76561198134705937', 'num_games_owned': 305, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 612, 'last_played': 1646836665}
review:
无人机块体间的模拟让人觉得十分难受，这种细节虽然“真实”可以理解，但着实是令人头大，引擎过多会引起帕金森？如果是以每个块的子块上限决定倒是可以接受，但游戏里并没有讲明白何种情况会在何时发生，或者说，是因为制作者直接通过物理模拟每个块导致每个块运动无法收敛而形成了bug没法处理？

这个游戏是非常优秀的，如果评分细化或者有中评，我是不会点不推荐的。
我不推荐的原因只是某些小问题破坏了我的游戏体验
（作者是不是模拟了每个子块组呀？如果添加“阻尼”没准帕金森有救，如果实在救不活，请务必在游戏中告知玩家触发这种情况的细致情况（“玩这个游戏过多会致死”->“连续玩这个游戏超过100年会致死”））
除此之外 每个部件的详细介绍 生存模式的玩法等我虽然感觉也有缺点，但还能接受，不过感觉还有巨大的改良空间（不重要，先救无人机“帕金森”吧）

author: {'steamid': '76561198026630555', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1641128049}
review:
Building drones is intuitive, and it's quite satisfying to test them out and see them flying. Playing the survival mode, exploring planets and doing missions, is fun. Graphics are sharp and clean, i quite like the look.  

I've not done any serious automation or played multi-player modes yet, but it seems to me the automation capabilities are a bit limited. Basically, you connect sensors to engines and weapons, turning things on and off.  There is no sequential programming and no way to work with  numbers/values. When more complex control is required, there are some pre-programmed behaviours to choose from (e.g. pointing the engine to a way-point, or in the direction of gravity)  but that's it.  I hope the developers are working on extending the automation system.

Liked the idea of the game, but it felt alittle frustrating, did a few Survival rounds but i kept softlocking in systems with certain objectives where a few parts i didnt have would come in handy. had to just brute force those planets until threat kept maxing out and my ship got destroyed, i get it a roguelite but i had no real fun with it in the end.

developer_response:
Hi Mia Ishata

Thank you for your feedback and liking the idea of Nimbatus :)

I'm sorry that the rogue-lite aspect of Nimbatus doesn't work out for you. We have a mode which is similar to survival but without the death-mechanic, but it's unfortunately a bit hidden in the sandbox settings.

If you make a new sandbox game, go to the settings and deactivate all options and turn on part-unlocking, you can play similar to survival, but have no limits or elements which can block or destroy your progress.

Here's a link to the description:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2108436858

I hope you can give it a try. I would love to hear back from you if that mode is more fun :)

Thank you for the feedback and cheers,
Markus

author: {'steamid': '76561198020661079', 'num_games_owned': 626, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1590404363}
review:
Edit: I was mistaken about one of the game modes and most of my complaints are invalid. See replies.

Original:

I have to down vote this for now. The foundation has a lot of potential, the ship design, exploration, and part collecting aspects of the game are pretty good, I want to like it and put more time into it, but there is one major problem. While not listed anywhere on the store page or in the tags currently, the only real "game" mode option right now is a permadeath roguelike with a heavy emphasis on killing you as fast as possible and making you start over. 

You have a "mothership" that flies around in space dropping drones on planets to do tasks, but every action you take builds up "threat" and when your threat is high there's a big baddy that comes along and shoots your mothership removing some health. Once your mothership health is gone, gameover. You can repair the damage with a certain rarer resource at certain randomized points you may or may not get to, because the game is heavily RNG, but every time you do repair the cost increases. I don't know if that repair cost caps at a certain point, but it very quickly reaches a point where it seems like you'd have to scrape together every ounce of that resource you can find just to keep your ship alive a little longer. It gets worse, while every action you take on a stage creates a predictable amount of threat allowing you to try to plan a safe route through so perhaps you don't need healing (some of the threat is reduced between stages/wormholes), the game is full of random events beyond your control that can significantly increase your threat out of nowhere. It feels like death is inevitable and unavoidable right from the start, and for me that makes it feel like, "Why bother trying?"

There are a lot of larger, more complex and interesting ship designs on the store page and in the screenshots, these are for the most part not actually realistic in actual gameplay. Every part you place on a drone design consumes resources every time you launch that drone, with a small buffer of like 10 parts early game which you can upgrade to like 30 or 35 maybe if you are lucky. Launching a drone with hundreds of parts generally just isn't realistic, first you have to find all those parts which you get 1-2 at a time from each mission, then the amount of resources you can gather while trying to avoid dying from threat is pretty minimal. If you look at the couple tiny drones in the screenshots that look like they are about to die, that's pretty much what you will be playing with the whole time.

There is a creative mode where you can build whatever you want, to me that's not really a game and I have no interest in it. There's also the basic PvP stuff, that might appeal to some people, I don't know how it works but I'm pretty sure it's just creative builds going head to head.

Bottom line, if there was an option on the survival mode to completely disable the threat mechanic there might be a pretty decent exploration/building game here. Otherwise, if you are into roguelikes and the idea of a combination of Reassembly and FTL appeals to you, you might enjoy this one. If you don't like roguelikes you probably wont have fun with this one.
developer_response:
Hi Astasia

Thank you for your in-depth feedback. This helps us to see where we succeeded and where we failed to communicate things properly.

You are correct, building those huge ships (300+ parts)  is something which is only viable in the sandbox mode. But this was our intention from the start.
The Survival provides a rogue-like experience for a certain kind of player, and if they would like to build bigger things without restrictions, we provide the Sandbox for that. The survival mode was build in a way that is also can appeal to people who are not experts at building games (=smaller drones are also viable). And if one would like to play with part unlocking, progression and everything, but doesn't like the death/threat mechanic, we have an option in the sandbox to turn that off.

Of couse that only matters, if we're able to communicate and provide all those information properly ingame :) It seems you like the game in general, so I'm sad to see that we failed to communicate how you can setup the game so that it maximizes fun for you.

I would love to hear if you would go to sandbox, turn on part unlocking and deactivate all other options, if that game mode provides what you're looking for. I hope I read your feedback correctly.
(Here's a link of how to set it up)
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2108436858

Please let me know if that mode is something which is fun for you. If that's the case we try to make it more visible for all other players as well :)

Thank you for your feedback and I hope to hear back from you.

Cheers,
Markus

review:
[h1]《Nimbatus - The Space Drone Constructor》 - дрон дрону рознь[/h1]

[table]
    [tr]
        [th]Рекомендация[/th]
        [th]✔️[/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Оценка[/td]
        [td]7/10[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Версия игры[/td]
        [td]1.0.7[/td]
    [/tr]
[/table] 

[b][u]Рекомендация:[/u][/b] [i]Интересно строить и создавать с нуля корабли в космосе[/i] - [b]хватай проект во все руки[/b]. [i]Любишь использовать всё готовое[/i] - [b]тогда это не то место.[/b]

[i]Палка, огурец и резинка от трусов - схема моего первого дрона.[/i]

[quote=Джэйсон Стутхем] Мой дрон - is fall. [/quote]

[h1]ЦЕЛЬ ПРОЕКТА[/h1]

Цель проста, необходимо путешествовать по космосу, собирать части кораблей и строить своих идеальных дронов для всё большего захвата частей и выполнения тех или иных миссий на планетах.

[h1]ОСНОВА[/h1]

Человечество не дремлет и сумело уже дойти до того уровня где не требуется запускать живые организмы в космос для изучения и большего. Достаточно отправить компьютер, который сам будет создавать, искать, обрабатывать и добывать всё что нужно. Вот за один такой супер компьютер на космическом корабле мы и играем. 

Отличный проект для тех кто любит создавать что-то своё. С нуля можно да и нужно создавать дроны под ваши определённые цели. Цели варьируются от миссий на планетах. А уж куда лететь и что добывать зависит сугубо от вас. Огромное количество галактик, систем и планет. Довольно много частей для создания. Есть возможность создавать самоуправляемых дронов для войны добычи и прочего. 

Чтобы тебе не было скучно и так уж легко, существует мега корпорация, которая против таких как ты и постоянно пытается найти тебя и уничтожить. Для этого любое твоё действие повышает процент обнаружения, сильно не буянь и будет тебе счастье.

[h1]ИТОГ[/h1]

Как по мне проект удался. Можно полностью окунуться в создание, а для пущего удовольствия строить только из того что есть и сумел сам добыть в тяжёлых боях. Логические элементы в игре дают еще больше возможностей и радости, особенно для инженеров. Создай свой лучший пепелац и достигни небывалых высот!

[u]7 кораблей корпорации из 10[/u]

review: 这个游戏你会不会觉得他很捞，你会！因为你不会，所以你才会。因为你只看到了第二层，而你把它想成了第一层，然而他在第五层。好了千层饼套完了，说正事了，总结来看游戏的开放性很强，你的可操作性空间很大，但是需要较强的逻辑思维能力。游戏刚给我的印象很捞，模块的连接不可以使用三角固定，只能一个连一个导致结构并不是很稳定，而且所有装备的触发都需要按住按钮，很费事。但是后来发现了逻辑模块，逻辑模块集合了每一种逻辑运算，还有各种功能性的按钮，你可以通过逻辑模块的组合达到很多类似游戏达不到的作品，比如按键激活对应的武器模块，甚至还以制作一个夹娃娃机。美中不足的是逻辑模块的占位实在是太大了，一个小模块所需要的逻辑模块甚至可能比功能部分还要大，挺影响船体美观的，而且有的时候逻辑模块的损失会导致整体飞船操作系统崩溃。总体还是瑕不掩瑜，不错的游戏，在设计中快乐，快乐码农养成器。

author: {'steamid': '76561198082630612', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1616, 'last_played': 1591146208}
review:
I like the core elements, but in its current state this game is both boring and frustrating.

The missions and locations are repetitive, with the former being either "pick this thing up and bring it back to the floating dumpster", or "kill x amount of these gremlins". Survival mode is sort of hard in the first couple galaxies, until you mine enough space-cash to be able to buy all the hull repairs you'll ever want. Then again, I did play as the Miner, who starts with parts capable of resource-mining and gets 2x mined loot throughout the game.
So there is also a teensy bit of imbalance in the starting classes.

The tutorial is WOEFULLY undefurnished. Very little information on the core mechanics, and nothing about Logic Parts, the most complex building components in the game. What the parts themselves do isn't unique to Nimbatus, but the game should at least tell you how to use them in the editor; do they need to be connected to a part to control it? What does the wireless connector do?

Stability is the most infuriating deliberate gameplay mechanic I've seen in...at least a week. You can build a nice-looking, perfectly-symmetrical drone that fits all your needs, only to have it shake apart in the test chamber. Even supposedly "stable" drones will slowly list to one side or the other due to micro-tremors as you fly in a straight line, which sucks eggs if you're a perfectionist or diagnosed Obsessive-Compulsive. And, if it's a bad enough drift, can impact the usefulness of the finished drone.

Speaking of this, there's also no "stress test" when testing your drone. So it could appear perfectly stable in the test chamber/simulator/whatever, but crap out on you in actual play, as the conditions there are less predictable. 

At this point, I'm wondering if stability even IS intentional, or if it's just a bug or shortcoming of the game engine which the developers chose not to squash. It's just annoying. It inhibits creativity, dramatically reducing the variety you can put into your builds without making them useless--and if you want your drone to fly in a straight line, you might spend additional hours just rearranging all the parts until either it works better or you give up. There's no clear pattern on which arrangements work and which ones don't--I've had builds where just switching two tiny parts with supposedly equal mass and volume made all the difference. 

It's not even remotely realistic. Each part only connects to one other part, with no "support struts" or crossbeams or anything, and yet if you attach too many parts to one central piece your drone will just become unstable, for reasons. This is confusing, since every drone includes the large octagonal "core" module, which all parts ultimately connect to and which forms the most stable/least wobbly connections. So what this means is that, if you have an unstable drone with too many pieces connected to the core module, you can switch some of them to instead connect to their neighbors (which will remain connected to the core), and somehow that makes it more stable, even though the core itself is still ultimately the loadbearer.

There's a wide selection of weapons for almost no reason. Some of these are near-useless, others are almost always useful, and which category a weapon falls into often depends on what, if any, modifiers it rolls with. It is currently possible to get the "damage downgrade" modifier, which reduces damage by 100%. Yep, that's right, you can get guns which do zero damage. Why? Beats me.

I like the core concept, as I said; it reminds me of those Flash games we all used to play online, and they're definitely the inspiration behind this. But the problem is that this game really doesn't provide much more than they did, except it comes with a price tag. I look forward to seeing the fixes the Devs implement, but in its current state I can't recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060688156', 'num_games_owned': 10119, 'num_reviews': 1366, 'playtime_forever': 689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 689, 'last_played': 1590147397}
review:
[b]画面[/b]
UNTIY引擎做的游戏。游戏的风格属于那种偏卡通的2D平面游戏，各种子弹的特效倒是做的花里胡哨的，全弹发射的时候看起来就像是在放烟花。
UNTIY引擎大家都知道，上限很高，只要能调教的好，做出来的画面可以非常的优秀，但是同样的，如果搞得不好，做出辣鸡画面也是正常的。
本作的话，作为一款太空建造模拟类游戏，我觉得已经是相当不错了。
画面好评！
[b]游戏性[/b]
《Nimbatus - The Space Drone Constructor》（太空无人机构造者）是由Stray Fawn Studio制作并发行的一款太空题材的沙盒模拟游戏。
简单说的话，游戏的玩法就是玩家自行建造无人机来探索星球并完成任务。
所以这个游戏就分成了两部分，一部分是建造无人机，另一部分就是探索并完成任务了。
对比起探索，个人觉得还是造无人机更有意思。而且本作中建造无人机也是最最浪费时间的地方了。
说起来上一次看到这种又要动手又要动脑的游戏就是《围攻》了，那个3D游戏，大佬们几乎用它造出了所有的机械，什么飞机坦克就不说了，高达和宇宙飞船都已经可以自动化生产了--给这群脑洞大开的大佬一个建造系统然后把他们扔到异界去，估计写本小说都够了。
本作虽然是2D平面游戏，建造的原件种类也简单粗暴，但是折并不影响这个游戏的复杂性和玩法。
从什么部件都没有的小无人机开始，一点点探索收集资源完成任务得到新的部件，然后用新部件设计出更好的无人机，继续去完成更难的探索和任务。
这中间的流程虽然简单，但是实际玩起来却是非常有意思的。
而游戏中的探索部分就比较简单了。
游戏中每个地图都会给一些任务，有的任务是随机的，有的是和星球当前的核心差有些关系。不过大致上任务就是收集，探索，消灭敌人这几种。
单人生存模式的主要玩法是选好角色（每个角色有自己的特点）并用有限的材料来进行无人机的建造。每次到达别的星球或者星系都会增加威胁度，如果威胁度过高玩家的飞船就会被攻击，飞船被敌人打爆，游戏也就失败了。
到达别的星系还需要一些资源才能通过虫洞，之后就是新的任务。
这就成了一个比较不错的闭环，玩家建造无人机并探索完成任务，然后得到新的任务和新的部件，建造新的无人机继续探索。
游戏有多人模式，更偏向竞技玩法，不同的模式有着不同的设计需求和不同的无人机。
对于我这种普通玩家来说，那里面就是神仙打架，就算是围观都会有些“不明觉厉”的感觉，让人情不自禁的感叹一句“大佬啊”~
不过游戏也有些让我想吐槽的地方。
首先是教程。
没错，游戏的基础教程和高级教程都可以说是简单明了，只要过一遍你就知道什么意思了。
但是问题来了，这个教程真的是太过于基础了，感觉有种老师教了1+1=2之后，直接给了玩家一张纸，让玩家证明歌德巴赫猜想。
当然实际上是玩家可以1+2，1+3那样玩下去，但是这种学习成本是非常大的，最大的成本就是时间了，造个无人机不知不觉就是一个小时，也是无话可说。
不过关于这个问题，因为游戏有创意工坊，玩家可以从创意工坊下载并导入设计图来进行编辑，所以其实就还好说。
但是第二个问题就很难受了。
游戏崩溃！
虽然说就算崩溃了，存档也不会坏，但是这对游戏的沉浸体验还是造成了不小的影响。
官方说这是引擎的问题，还是希望官方能够早点修复这个问题吧。
游戏之前没有中文，所以一直忍着没有入手，而现在有中文了，各种部件的用法也都可以看得懂了，虽然玩的还是很菜，但是好歹能玩了！
游戏性好评。
[b]声音[/b]
BGM和音效的水准都比较一般般吧，大概是我精力都集中在造无人机上了，所以没有注意这些无关紧要的地方。
[b]评分[/b]
8/10
作为一款不仅需要动手还需要动脑的模拟类游戏，本作可以说是非常有趣了。
最近还加了官方汉化，之前就看中了但是因此没有购买的玩家已经可以入手了。
另外推荐喜欢太空沙盒模拟建设类游戏的玩家购买试试。

author: {'steamid': '76561198019466684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 609, 'playtime_forever': 548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1590082637}
review:
[table][th]
Review by [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34633003-Gaming-Masterpieces/] Gaming Masterpieces [/url]  - The greatest games of all time on Steam. 
[/th][/table]

Another masterpiece here? I'd say yes, but you have to like to construct stuff and you need some dexterity to actually use your constructs later. The first part of the game consists of building a small drone, you only have a few parts (energy source, propulsion, weapons) which you can arrange around the core. Sounds easy, is easy. The editor to construct your drones works fine... but this does not mean that the drone works fine in reality. My best ideas did not work at all in "reality", so you are advised to actually test anything you have constructed. Adjust the angel of the thrusters, put the battery a bit more to the back, fix the shooting angle of the cannon, assign a key (kb or gamepad) to operate the thing... even tiny drones are complicated. The tutorial is not that great, especially when you come to the point where you can use automatic functions. Experimenting with how the stuff you build works is part of the game experience... and sometimes it simply does NOT work as desired.

After constructing a drone you have to use it. In single player mode you send it to its target and operate all its functions for collecting things, destroying things, fighting enemies... or use it in multiplayer, where you have 5 modes to compete with other players (racing, fighting, showing off your cool drone,...). If you don't like multiplayer or to follow the single player story, you can also construct a drone in sandbox mode.

The story puts you in command of a drone constructing spaceship that escaped from the evil "Corp" and is now driving from galaxy to galaxy, collecting information, resources & technology while upgrading your mothership and your drones. The story is not really THAT great, though, and the presentation... could be improved. The universe is randomly generated and the complexity of the drones you can build soon becomes quite impressive. Construct (and fly) drones with dozens of parts to fulfill the missions, you can have multiple drones in your hangar, specifically designed for certain tasks.

After quite some time in Early Access, the game looks rather polished now. Ultrawidescreen supported, controller supported, no crashes (for me). Building larger drones and changing things on them is quite a time-consuming activity, you have to work on every part one by one. Guess this could be made easier. 

[u][b] Conclusion:[/b][/u]
Great game for space drone designing engineers.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971506372', 'num_games_owned': 492, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 963, 'last_played': 1590084229}
review:
I wanted to like this cos I like build-then-fly/fight type games. I just can't fall in love with this game though. 

Its pretty rough around the edges despite being a released game. There's little help with the parts, the tutorial seems to give up after a couple of missions, the cut-scenes are dire, there's hardly any story...

Ships are hard to control. There seems to be no way to handle recoil for most weapons, resulting in your ship being blown all over the place on each shot. 

The missions are really repetitive. You skip around an asteroid shooting some things and either kill the right things or grab something. That's about it. 

There's no way to tell what power your ship has left or what damage it has taken. You can drop off you energy/fuel/storage stuff and then set off on your mission only to find yourself suddenly adrift with no engines and no weapons for no apparent reason. 

The concept of your mother-ship taking damage is just a stupid RNG thing that adds nothing to the game. It increases frustration and means wasting resources on a trip to a 'garage' that can lead to more damage.  

Maybe in another year or so it might be worth taking a look. For now it's not worth the bother.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962259381', 'num_games_owned': 197, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1645, 'last_played': 1590251141}
review:
Once you get into it, you can spend hours designing and building drones - fully, part or not automated. I have been meaning to write a review all day, but I had just discovered ways to beat the campaign in "Programmer" mode, where you have to use fully automated drones (no user input), and it was a case of "just one more design session", and so I have only just got round to writing the review.

The game is about designing drones, which fly around shooting and moving things. There is a campaign (based around performing tasks on very tiny planets), a sandbox campaign where you design your own campaign, and multiplayer where you pit your drone designs against other players' drones in 5 different game types, including sumo (push out of the ring) and race.

Drones are split into parts which can be structural, weapons, defence, movement, sensors and logic gates. You configure the drone parts with inputs, outputs and other parameters. There is even a drone part that makes other drones when you are using it, self-replicating drones!

It's a steep learning curve and the campaign is very hard when you first play it (easy mode recommended!), but that's because there are a lot of moving parts and it can get complicated quickly. But it's very addictive, it's the kind of game where you end up thinking about what you can build while you are not playing, and want to go and try things out. There is so much scope here.

The devs are actively updating all the time and are currently improving the wiki and information on what all the drone parts do, and released an update today, just a couple of days after first release.

There are potentially hundreds of hours of gameplay here, and the game is under £20. It's so worth the money, and if you like things like Factorio or Kerbal Space Program it's a must buy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198108003155', 'num_games_owned': 277, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1590054323}
review:
Задумка классная, механики тоже вроде как интересные - но вот реализация и проработка ужасна. 
Далее идёт личное впечатление от игры:
В режими развития, где нужно постепенно находить части корабля в начале вам дают очень мало деталей, и лично мне на протяжении трёх часов игры так и не встретилось планет с дополнительными двигателями. 
Что бы вы понимали - перемещение в этой игре, ваш главный враг. Откройте любой тсрим или запись игры и вы непременно увидите что основой геймплея состоит борьба с ужасно неудобным управлением и постоянными резкими переворотами, разворотами, зацеплением за препятствие и т. д. 
В результати вместо интересного исследования планет, сбора ресурсов, перестрелок с врагами, конструировании новых элементов своего дрона: в сюжете вы несколько часов будите цепляясь за выступы, перелетая через цели, раскручиваясь как волчок - пытаться добыть немножко руды и пройти лишнюю миссию.
не понятно зачем такая проработка боевой системы и пушек, если до этого момента нужно вытерпеть несколько часов душного геймплея.
Меня не хватило.
Стоит ли покупать? В текущем балансе точно нет, им надо менять стартовый набор деталей для дрона, добавлять новые части упрощающие управление и т. д.
Очень разочарован в игре, но рефанд делать не хотел и не хочу. Верю что пару патчей могут сделать из игры конфетку.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135198923', 'num_games_owned': 2685, 'num_reviews': 360, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1589992401}
review:
[h1]尼姆巴图——从零开始的无人机设计与应用实务[/h1]
很有趣的造无人机游戏，也正因为是无人机，所以只需要担心机毁不需要担心人亡。已经有了官中，早期只能看着不同元件挠头的日子一去不复返啦。

从各种方面来讲都有点Besiege的味儿（主要指看神仙打架），具有无限的可能性。虽然是2D平面，各种元素的风格也够简单粗暴，但丝毫不影响它好玩，毕竟看见自己从零开始设计（虽然一开始还是有一块可以自爆的核心的←自爆需要自己部署按键）的无人机能够好好的围绕星球航行收集资源击坠敌人完成任务还是很有成就感的。简言之，这就是个建飞船，开飞船，甚至可以自动开飞船的既需要手也需要脑的游戏。希望之后能够增加任务多样性，让那神仙打架来的更猛烈些罢，我已经准备好啦。

[h1]半小时学步，一小时设计，五分钟完成目标[/h1]
单人模式中的任务机制虽然看起来像是随机任务，但一部分任务好像与星球的核心有关，不过基本上就分为几类，分别为收集，灭杀，探索等。生存模式中需要获取点数才能进行星际穿梭，星球下面的小三角数量表示任务能够获得的点数，但回报更大就必然预示着风险更大，可以由玩家自己进行抉择。
而多人模式更偏向竞技，不同的模式有着不同的设计需求，对我来说可能就只剩围观神仙打架了。

设计模式下可用元件很多，不同的武器也可以搭载不同的升级模块，无论在外观方面和功能性上都展现出了无限的可能性。可以给元件配置皮肤这点蛮好玩的，但逻辑元件有一定的门槛，需要一定的编程基础。

我觉着我打开游戏过了序章之后的前30分钟完全就是在尝试怎么放置推进器才能够好好转向，结果终于能够好好在试飞里面飞的时候才想起来序章结束之后好像有弹出窗口说收集资源的部分建议体验教程。

教程中的基础教程真的基础，高级教程也真的基础。说是逻辑部件结果就真的只教了一个开关，说是传感器真就只讲了一个距离传感器。这就很有一种老师教了一个汉字“一”，但今天的作业是给“蠿龘羃齏瀪澷譱鷆齅黱”注音的感觉。
虽然可能会摸不着头脑，但好在沙盒模式可以加载创意工坊设计，同时已加载的创意工坊设计可以通过导入进行编辑。如果实在不知道应该怎么去设计自己的机体或者是有些自己很难摸索明白原理的元件可以以这种方式为起点上手展开自己的设计。

单人模式中生存模式只能利用不同角色的有限材料对无人机进行构建，同时每次部署至星球可能会增加一定的威胁度并消耗一定资源，哪怕当前星球的任务已经完成也是一样的。所以可以在沙盒模式摸清元件作用之后再去快乐游戏，加了诸多限制之后说不定会有更多的乐趣。

author: {'steamid': '76561198030794979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 11717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4100, 'last_played': 1691085733}
review:
However,
I'd recommend this game ONLY if you are looking for a programming/puzzler game, and are willing to put up with a frustratingly difficult method of building/ programming your drones.
The game clearly tried to cater to both programmer/puzzler fans and more casual builder fans ... and that was probably a mistake. If you are looking for a fun builder game, this is not it. The builder and piloting gameplay is incredibly shallow and short, you can find better games that are free.
The programmer/puzzler is more interesting, and I had some fun overcoming several missions as the programmer captain and in the sumo ring. 
Sadly, the fact that hey tried to keep things "simple" by making every bit-wise operation a separate building block in your drone, means it's incredibly frustrating to program even the simplest of actions.

Overall if you're desperate for a new programming/puzzle game, there really isn't a wealth of choice out there, so pick this up if you're OK with doing simple things in difficult ways.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063298993', 'num_games_owned': 501, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 3338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1701987450}
review:
Ich bin Streamer und habe meine ersten Eindrücke gestreamt: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z9iv2Hm9frs

Alles was ich an Vorwissen hatte um in dieses Spiel zu gehen war: Du baust eine Drohne oä. und fliegst sie.
Alles was ich bisher über das Spiel weiß: Das Vorwissen war korrekt.

Zu Beginn sind die Tutorials wirklich zu empfehlen, sie sind kurz und prägnant geschrieben, es gibt kaum Informationen welche überflüssig erscheinen. Für absolute Neueinsteiger ins Thema "PC-Spielen" ist das Spiel aber nichts. Man muss schon eine Vorstellung von Ursache und Wirkung in PC-Spielen haben um auf die richtigen Lösungen für Probleme zu kommen.

Das Spielprinzip ist genau so einfach wie oben beschrieben: 1. Baue eine Drohne, 2. Wirf Sie auf den Planetoiden und 3. Steuere sie nicht zu Tode - Fertig.

Man kann zu Beginn der Story aus 6 verschiedenen Charakteren auswählen, welche alle unterschiedliche Boni haben welche den Spielstil beeinflussen. Ich habe mich für den "Programmer" entschieden, weil mir das Spiel sagte: Das ist nur was für Experten - und wenn mir ein Spiel sowas sagt, bin ich immer Versucht genau diesen Weg zu gehen.

Als Programmer fällt Schritt 3 weg, du baust Drohnen und sie müssen sich selbst über den Planetoiden bewegen ohne, dass man selbst noch eingreifen kann.
Dieser Charakter verlegt das Spiel zum größten Teil in den Hangar um die Drohne zu bauen und zu automatisieren.

Wer Angst vor Logik Gittern o.ä. hat sollte also den Programmer nicht nehmen.

Fehler habe ich nur sehr wenige gesehen und noch weniger bemerkt. Die meisten Fehler sind, wie bei vielen dieser Programmierspiele, von mir selbst gekommen, aber das Spiel hat auch hier und da geringe Grammatikschwächen und der eine oder andere Sensor funktioniert nicht so schön wie er sollte.

Alles in allem ist das Spiel natürlich sehr auf den persönlichen Spielstil zugeschnitten, da man selbst bestimmt, mit welcher Drohne man den Planetoiden bewirft und wie man sie steuert.

Wer also schon ein paar Stunden Spieleerfahrung hat sollte Nimbatus mal eine Chance geben und selbst ein oder zwei Drohnen auf Asteroiden werfen um zu sehen was passiert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032241465', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1617331558}
review:
TL;DR: Automation makes this game. Play this game in "Programmer" mode.

Nimbatus feels like a game that doesn't quite know what it wants to be. It presents the idea of building and fighting drone ships, a touch of exploration and resource gathering, and a dash of drone automation, but from the store page and media, it seems mostly focused on the combat, which is quite underwhelming to say the least. This game really comes into its own with the automation mechanics, which is disappointing because they're so optional most players won't ever use them, but they take this game to a whole new level. 

I started the game in "Programmer" mode, since the automation tools introduced in the _optional_ tutorial had intrigued me, and since I'm a programmer by day, I decided to check it out; right away I was engaged. Trying to figure out how to get my first little Digbot to find the resources and dig towards them without any inputs from me took longer than it should have, but was super satisfying when I finally saw that little worm-looking drone chewing through the planet searching for crates. This satisfaction was only amplified as I proceeded through further levels in survival and the tasks grew ever more complex. I'm so glad I played this game with programmer mode on first, and I highly recommend that anyone who likes Zachtronics games or any factory/automation games to try this mode first as well.

For a new release, this game is great, though there are a few quality of life improvements that would be fantastic to see come forth in the ship editor, I have no doubts that the developers will be responsive to the complaints which are in enough reviews I don't need to add them again here.

8/10 - Great automation system, needs some polish, and maybe some commitment to being an automation puzzle/combat game (remember CarnageHeart?)

author: {'steamid': '76561198007371778', 'num_games_owned': 274, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 781, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 781, 'last_played': 1589964111}
review:
A fun little space shooter/builder kinda game.

Gameplay: So there are two parts, one the build your own spaceship and the exploration/combat sections. The build mechanics are pretty simple and easy to understand, with some more advanced logic gate bits in there. The space exploration and combat is OK at first, but the game starts to recycle the same types of missions and planets are a while and the game feels a bit samey. 

Graphics: They’re pretty enough, the particle effects are good and doesn’t lag out. 

Story: Simplistic but serves its purpose. 

Overall, it’s a fun little game you’ll get a few hours out of, the exploration/combat does feel a little cooked. Perhaps a few more enemy, planet and mission types would help out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117682191', 'num_games_owned': 489, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1706587193}
review:
Joguinho MUITO legal que vai te divertir por muito tempo, você tem várias peças e pode fazer um monte de coisas bacanas. Tem um modo sandbox customizável e um modo sobrevivência onde você vai de planeta em planeta fazendo missões (Com os seus drones, é claro) para ganhar partes e recursos. Tem vários personagens que te dão habilidades diferentes e umas mecânicas legais, mas você vai comprar o jogo pelo modo sandbox mesmo.

Nimbatus tem uma quantidade bem grande de peças de lógica (Computacional, como peças if, or, and, xor, etc., e outras de lógica do próprio jogo mesmo, como sensores de direção, velocidade, altura, etc.), o que significa que você pode fazer praticamente qualquer coisa. É bem fácil de aprender e você pode fazer drones doidos como uma minhoca espacial homicida ou uma nave enorme que carrega vários drones de caça completamente autônomos com lança-foguetes de fragmentação teleguiados.

Ah, sim, eu já falei que tem um editor de armas? Não? Bom, tem sim. Não é muito complexo, mas você pode escolher 3 de várias "perks", algumas bem interessantes e o tipo de munição (Normal [Balas], plasma, deconstrução biológica e gelo) para enfiar em uns 10 tipos diferentes de armas.

Se você ainda não está convencido, o jogo é tipo, 35 reais? Se você deixar de ir ao McDonalds por um dia (Espero que não vá na quarentena de qualquer jeito), você consegue comprar. Nimbatus vale muito a pena comprar, especialmente considerando que ele saiu apenas 6 dias atrás e já está em um estado bom assim.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058932507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1589679897}
review:
This game looks fun until you play it. Its a repetitive shell of a game that looks promising. I wish I could give this a thumbs up and recommend it but I can't. And here's why...
                                                                             
 *The Good*

* Spaceship customization. It's pretty fun to build and come up with different type of spaceships for mining, or killing an enemy. but it does get confusing because it doesn't hold your hand and explain everything.
* Graphics and Frame rate. The Graphics are sharp and clean even the colors and how the neon lights of your ship glow as well as the particle effects. Frame rate does not take a hit at all. which I'm impressed especially if you build a giant monster ship or something.
* Rogue like game play. I enjoy Roguelite games so the random loot for completing a mission is a plus.
                                                                                   
  *The Bad*

* Same 3 types of enemies. Ones that float and follow you, Shoot and chase you. Or stationary ones that shoot up in the sky like anti air.
* Planets. I really hoped that this would have made the game but it doesn't all the planets are empty. there's some enemies on each planet but they feel hollow and I think it feels this way because of the missions. ( I'll explain this more below.)
* The missions. What were they thinking? These missions are the same every time. Retrieve an item (Freezer Or ships blackbox) Kill or destroy Something. ( Corp transmitter, Hive, Overheating or pirate mines.)  Explore an area/planet. These should help each planet feel different but they don't. It just feels like you're doing the same thing every time you go to a solar system.
* The soundtrack! Why did you guys choose those tracks? They sound grim and you'll hear the same track like 5 times in a row. This game should have an action/ creativity inspired track.
*  If you put too many items on one part of your ship it'll wig out and start spazzing out so hard that literal parts of your ship will blow up. Not sure if this is a feature or glitch either way this is pretty lame considering that this game is about letting your imagination run wild.
                                                             
 *Conclusion*
This game would be good if it was still in Early access and if it was 10$ But I can't justify the 20.00$ Price point. You'll get a couple hours of fun out of this game but I can't see getting hundreds out of it. The game feels empty and repetitive. Even with the creative mode you'll get bored fast because there aren't that many scenarios to use your ship on. I'd rate this a 5/10 maybe a 6/10 if there were more missions and added more features. But right now it's going to get refunded.

review:
Halle alle zusammen,

Intro: 

Nimbatus ist ein Weltraum-Simulator in dem Ihr eine kleine fliegende Dronenfabrik leitet und das unerforschte Weltall erkundet. Dabei werdet Ihr immer neuen Gefahren und Herausforderungen gegenüber stehen. Das Weltall selbst scheint zufallsgeneriert zu sein.

Ihr habt endtweder einen Storry Modus oder einen Freien Modus zur Auswahl.

Sound: 8/10 gelungen für diese Art Spiel
Grafik: 7/10 hätte mir ein Paar mehr effekte gewünscht, sonst sehr ansprechend für ein 2d Spiel
Inhalt: nach so kurzer Zeit noch nicht bewertbar. Aber der Schwierigkeitsgrad nimmt enorm zu, je weiter man vorran schreitet.

Eindrücke könnt Ihr wie immer auf meinem Twitch Kanal erhaschen!
https://www.twitch.tv/abraxsus1983

review:
I liked it for about 3 Missions. But then it went to a mess...

The mechanic is based on everything you see needs to be mined. The way the difficulty curves is totally random. Level 3 Missions can be "get a little fight" to "The heck is this enemy type that is not taking damage?" without indicators outside the mission. I now give up after i needet to restart a Mission 5 times because it was bugged, then the game crashed, i reloaded and the detection percentage was up to 80... so no use to go on with this run... 
No tooltipps or usafull tutorials. The options are so limited that you can not change the volume outside of a running game. 

 Also Bugs: Worldlimits that pop up on the planet surfaces and bug your ship so you need a restart. Crahes to desktop while building new drones.

飞船设计环节很好，可定制程度很高，这一点比Reassembly优秀不少。
但任务设计和实际玩法很糟糕，根本不是我购买时想象的样子，任务繁杂无趣，主线类似FTL但机制又不太平衡
武器定制系统很好，但他本可以有更好的发挥

不知道以后还会不会更新。目前来说只适合益智类玩家，想星球大战什么的还是再等等吧。
性价比略低，相比之下定价偏高
游戏不缺好评，我先挂个差评

author: {'steamid': '76561198033263509', 'num_games_owned': 2923, 'num_reviews': 570, 'playtime_forever': 1257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1087, 'last_played': 1589994826}
review:
Мы  управляем  кораблём,  бороздящим  просторы  космоса  и  не  каким-то  захудалым  крейсером  или  фрегатом,  а  целой  автоматизированной  фабрикой  по  созданию  дронов!  И  цель  наша  не  много  ни  мало  –  путь  к  дальним  рубежам  и  исследование  новых  миров!

Имеется  три  режима  игры  –  Выживание,  Песочница  и  Арена.  Выживание  –  мини-кампания,  где  предстоит  выбрать  капитана  и  улепётывать  из  галактики  в  галактику  от  злобных  преследователей,  попутно  спускаясь  на  планеты,  дабы  выполнять  задания.  Песочница  –  практически  то  же  самое,  что  и  сюжет,  только  никаких  ограничений  нет,  кроме  тех,  что  вы  выставите  себе  самостоятельно.  Арена  –  сетевые  сражения  с  дронами  других  людей,  к  сожалению,  можно  выставлять  лишь  автоматизированные  единицы.

Во  всех  трёх  режимах  главное  –  непосредственно  процесс  создания  дронов.  В  этом  аспекте  игра  раскрывается  в  полной  мере  –  десятки  разных  деталей  и  почти  никаких  преград  для  творчества.  Бери  и  конструируй  неповоротливый  огнемётный  дрон,  заливающий  экран  яркими  всполохами  химического  огня.  Или  можешь  соорудить  конструкцию  из  датчиков  и  сенсоров  без  прямого  управления.  А  если  добавил  топливных  баков  и  двигателей  сверх  всякой  меры,  да  ещё  и  шипов  спереди  наставил,  получай  на  выходе  смертоносный  болид.  В  ангаре  за  созданием  дронов  времени  тратится  в  разы  больше,  чем  на  посещение  планет.

Хотя  процедурно  генерируемые  астрономические  тела,  конечно,  также  заслуживают  внимания.  Имеется  несколько  разных  типов  планет  от  обыденных  кусков  камня  и  грязи  до  миров  с  бурлящей  лавой  и  ледяными  ветрами.  Разумеется,  на  поверхностях  планет  обитают  всевозможные  существа,  их  не  так  много  как  хотелось  бы,  но  тактики  сражения  и  поведения  у  них  разные.

Единственным  встреченным  недостатком  отмечу  то,  что  мой  антивирус  в  какой-то  момент  решил,  что  игрушка  уж  слишком  увлекательная  и  потёр  мои  сохранения,  причём  настолько  избирательно,  что  прогресс  в  достижении  галактики  сохранился,  а  вот  ресурсы  и  улучшения  материнского  корабля  нет.  Произошло  это  на  самой  первой  версии  вышедшей  в  релиз,  потому  это  вероятно  будет  исправлено,  когда  разработчики  обратятся  в  поддержку  антивируса.

Резюме:  простой  в  освоении  конструктор  дронов  достойный  всестороннего  ознакомления.
